# Draft:Barwar massacre

Kurdish forces under Mustafa Barzani
| partof = First Iraqi–Kurdish War
}}
The Barwar massacre occurred in 1962 in the village of Barwar, Iraq, when Kurdish forces loyal to Mustafa Barzani killed 32-33 Assyrian men, including the village priest. The attack was part of the First Iraqi-Kurdish War.
Background
The massacre was documented in Reforging a Forgotten History by Sargon Donabed, which states Mustafa Barzani massacred thirty-two of the village's men, including the priest."
